title: Watching the NBA Is Intense If Your Dad Is Carmelo Anthony
text:

1. How to Passive Aggressively Feud With You Boss 
We all face conflict with our superiors at work, but sometimes it’s hard to voice our grievances in a way that’s both purposeful and professional. Melo often takes the “I’m gonna say one thing but really mean another thing” approach when dealing with Knicks president Phil Jackson , which could be a nice template for his son when Kiyan wants to argue with his boss in a low-key rebellious and contentious way. 
2. How to Stick To Your Skills and Alienate Your Coworkers 
Melo is one of the last purveyors of the NBA’s old-school isolation play style, when one guy would take the ball and try to beat his defender one-on-one to score. Nowadays, basketball is much more pass-centric, so Melo’s game seems more selfish with modern glasses. Kiyan could pick up a lot of tips from his dad on how to phase out his partners and teammates for greater individual glory. 
3. How to Leverage Your Business Acumen With Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles 
Did you know Melo wants to start a clothing line? Did you know his first move toward doing so was to partner with the most recent Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles sequel to release some TMNT-specific apparel for Macy’s ? It was a great showcase of selling out for a young child just beginning to look at his father as an example of how to maintain your personal vision and integrity as an entrepreneur. Good on Melo.
